histore.archive.serialize.default moduleÂ¶

Default object serializer for dataset archives.

class histore.archive.serialize.default.DefaultSerializer(timestamp: Optional[str] = 't', pos: Optional[str] = 'p', name: Optional[str] = 'n', cells: Optional[str] = 'c', value: Optional[str] = 'v', key: Optional[str] = 'k', rowid: Optional[str] = 'r', colid: Optional[str] = 'c', version: Optional[str] = 'v', valid_time: Optional[str] = 'vt', transaction_time: Optional[str] = 'tt', description: Optional[str] = 'd', action: Optional[str] = 'a')Â¶

Bases: histore.archive.serialize.base.ArchiveSerializer

Implementation of the archive object serializer. This is the default serializer used by HISTORE.

The default serializer is configurable with respect to the labels that are used in the serialization. Given labels should not start with the reserved character â$â which is being used to encode the type of special values that cannot be serialized by the default JSON encoder.

serialize_timestamp(ts: histore.archive.timestamp.Timestamp) → ListÂ¶

Get serialization for atimestamp object. A timestamp is serialized as a list of 2-dimensional lists that contain the start and end version of the time interval.

Parameters

ts (histore.archive.timestamp.Timestamp) â Archive timestamp object is a list of time intervals.

Returns

Return type

serialize_value(value: histore.archive.value.ArchiveValue, ts: histore.archive.timestamp.Timestamp) → Union[Dict, List]Â¶

Get serialization for a timestamp value. Depending on whether the value is a single version value or a multi-version value either a dictionary (single version) or a list of dictionaries (multi-version) is returned.

Parameters

  • value (histore.archive.value.ArchiveValue) â Timestamped value in a dataset archive.

  • ts (histore.archive.timestamp.Timestamp) â Timestamp of the parent object.

Returns

Return type

list or dict

histore.archive.serialize.default.validate_label(label: str) → strÂ¶

Ensure that the given label does not start with the reserved â$â character.

Returns the given label if valid. Raises a ValueError if an invalid label is given.

Parameters

label (string) â Label for serialization of an archive component.

Returns

string
